entry.title: Year later, AP reporter recalls origins of Ferguson movement
entry.summary: Ferguson became the impetus for a national movement.

entry.title: Commentary: On the origins of the Ferguson movement, a year later
entry.summary:
On Aug. 9, I returned home from a bike ride to learn that a young black man had been fatally shot by a white Ferguson police officer.

What we didn?t know at the time was the depth of mistrust between black residents and the predominantly white Ferguson Police Department, a level of suspicion that no doubt fueled what happened next.

entry.title: Year later, AP reporter recalls origins of Ferguson movement
entry.summary:
ST. LOUIS (AP) - EDITOR'S NOTE - A year ago, most Americans had never heard of the St. Louis suburb called Ferguson.

Until August 2014, Ferguson, Missouri, wasn't the kind of place that generated much news.

My wife's grandmother lived in Ferguson until she died in 1991, so I spent some time there as a young man.

But since joining the St. Louis office of The Associated Press in 1993, I had never been to Ferguson as a reporter.

The next day, as Ferguson police prepared for a news conference to explain what happened, I was among a crowd of reporters who heard distant chanting.

Never before had the anger been as intense as in Ferguson.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary: FILE - In this undated photo provided by the Brown family is Michael Brown, a young black man who was fatally shot on Aug. 9, 2014 by a white Ferguson, Mo., policeman.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Aug. 9, 2014, file photo, a police tactical team moves in to disperse a group of protesters following the shooting of a young black man by a white policeman in Ferguson, Mo.

When a white Ferguson policeman fatally shot a young black man nearly a year ago, the St. Louis suburb erupted in violent protests and the nation took notice.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary:
Chappelle-Nadal, who was among the those tear gassed by police while protesting Michael Brown's shooting with her constituents in Ferguson, Mo., said as a state, Missouri has not done much.

Lawmakers filed about 65 bills stemming from the events in Ferguson passing just one, a measure limiting municipal court fines and traffic tickets.

ADVANCE FOR MONDAY, AUG. 3, 2015 AND THEREAFTER - FILE - In this Aug. 20, 2014 file photo, protesters march in the street as lightning flashes in the distance in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: 'Mission: Impossible' star Rebecca Ferguson: ready, set, action
entry.summary:
Rebecca Ferguson plays Ilsa, who may or may not be on Ethan Hunt's side in "Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation."

But his "Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation" co-star Rebecca Ferguson is no slouch.

entry.title: Panel examining Missouri Gov. Jay Nixon's decisions over Ferguson has met just twice
2 meetings held by panel examining Ferguson decisions
entry.summary:
Nixon declared a state of emergency before the grand jury's decision in November, saying St. Louis County police would be in charge in Ferguson with the National Guard deployed to assist them.

The Ferguson mayor said he was unable to get the National Guard to help control the protests.

Without another committee meeting, St. Louis County Police Chief Jon Belmar said he may never disclose more details about how and when he learned the National Guard wouldn't be in Ferguson.

entry.title: Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson attend 'Mission: Impossible' premiere
Ferguson presses several-hour, unity-minded cleanup effort ahead of Brown anniversary
Ferguson presses cleanup bid ahead of Brown anniversary
entry.summary:
One of the areas hardest hit by last year's unrest in Ferguson, Missouri, that followed the police shooting death of 18-year-old Michael Brown is getting a little sprucing.

An organizer, Roy Gillespie, says the cleanup was less about beautification than it was about building regional unity by drawing in Ferguson residents and outsiders to pitch in.

entry.title: Ferguson hires black police commander as interim chief
entry.summary: Thomas Jackson, Ferguson's police chief for five years, resigned just days after that report.

entry.title: Ferguson hires Arizona black police commander as interim chief
entry.summary: Andre Anderson speaks with Ferguson City Council member Wesley Bell, right, after being introduced as the the interim chief of the Ferguson Police Department during a news conference on Wednesday, July 22, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Ferguson hires black police chief
entry.summary: He said he is interested in becoming Ferguson's permanent police chief.

entry.title: Ferguson hires another interim police chief
entry.summary: The Ferguson police force has changed leadership again, with a third chief in four months.

entry.title: Ferguson hires another interim police chief
entry.summary:
Anderson previously was police commander in the Phoenix suburb of Glendale, Arizona - the same city from which Ferguson recently hired its interim city manager, Ed Beasley.

Following the report, Ferguson's municipal judge, city manager and Police Chief Tom Jackson resigned.

entry.title: Ferguson hires Andre Anderson as new interim police chief
Ferguson to hire new interim police chief
entry.summary: Glendale is the same city where Ferguson leaders chose its interim city manager, Ed Beasley.

entry.title: Ferguson to hire another interim police chief as anniversary of Michael Brown's death nears
